page.title: 06HAS HAGLEY CHANGED?
page.content: Hagley today is on the very edge of the West Midlands Conurbation. It is separated on its northern and western limits from Halesowen and Stourbridge, by ever-narrowing strips of open country and farmland. Older residents note with some alarm the{growth in house building}in Hagley in the last 25 years. For example, Middlefield Lane at the turn of the century had only about 11-12 houses, and{Hagley had few shops,}such as a grocers, cobblers, bakers and ironmonger. Each week, the main village entertainment was a film show, run by{Mr Geoffrey Baker.}The nearest doctor was at Clent, with a dispensary at Stourbridge. Now, West Hagley has many more shops and many feel that Hagley generally has lost its old feeling of rural isolation and{close community spirit.
